intro: Arariba alba, commonly known as the white arariba, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy white flowers with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near rivers and in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical ecosystems.
